issues.description: Constructor parameter mismatch: The commented example in the template Main.java uses two-argument constructors for the animals (e.g. Seal("Clarabelle", "marine")), but the problem statement and the solution implementation treat Animal subclasses as having only a name attribute and use single-argument constructors (e.g. Seal("Clarabelle")). This inconsistency can confuse students about how many attributes each Animal should have and which constructor signature to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the constructor usage consistent across artifacts. Either modify the commented example in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java to use single-argument constructors (e.g. Seal("Clarabelle"), Pig("Doodle"), Goat("Buttinsky")) to match the problem statement and solution, or update the problem statement/UML and solution to include the additional attribute (and corresponding constructor parameter) if the second parameter was intended. Preferably remove the extra second parameter from the template Main to avoid confusing students.
